short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Search selected text on YouTube quickly with a right-click or by clicking an icon. Enable or disable the feature from the popup

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Instructions to use "YouTube Quick Search"

1. Install the Extension:
- Download and install YouTube Quick Search from the Chrome Web Store.

2. Enable/Disable the Search Icon:
- Click on the extension icon in the browser toolbar to open the popup.
- Use the checkbox to enable or disable the display of the search icon next to highlighted text on web pages.

3. Search on YouTube via Right-Click:
- Highlight any text on a webpage that you want to search on YouTube.
- Right-click on the highlighted text.
- In the context menu, select the "Search on YouTube" option.
- A new tab will open, displaying the YouTube search results for the selected text.

4. Search on YouTube via Search Icon:
- If the search icon feature is enabled, highlight any text on a webpage.
- An icon will appear next to the highlighted text.
- Click the icon to instantly search the highlighted text on YouTube.
- A new tab will open with the YouTube search results.

5. Adjusting Settings:
- To change the extension settings, click on the extension icon in the browser toolbar.
- You can enable or disable the search icon feature from the popup window.

Tips:
- Quick Search: Use the right-click context menu option for a fast and easy way to search without having to navigate away from the page.
- Toggle Icon: If you prefer not to see the search icon on every selection, you can easily disable it in the settings.

Troubleshooting:
- Icon Not Appearing: If the search icon does not appear after text selection, ensure it is enabled in the extension's popup settings. If the problem persists, try refreshing your browser.
- Context Menu Option Missing: Ensure the extension is installed and enabled. If the problem persists, try refreshing your browser.
